title: Marooned
description: The pilot episode that tells the tale of a tiny ship which set off on a three-hour tour but got caught in a storm and crashed on an island. The pilot was filmed in November 1963, and not aired until almost 30 years later.

title: Two on a Raft
description: The seven castaways awaken aboard the S.S. Minnow, which is beached and damaged on an uncharted tropical island. The Skipper and Gilligan set about making a raft to float them back to civilization, but encounter some unexpected difficulties in the process.

title: Home Sweet Hut
description: The seven castaways decide that they're unwilling to all share the same dwelling, so they break up into teams to construct four separate huts. A violent storm is on the horizon, so time is of the essence, and with Gilligan trying to help, there's plenty of setbacks.

title: Voodoo Something to Me
description: Something is breaking into the supply hut at night, then Gilligan disappears and in his place a chimp appears wearing his clothes, causing the Skipper to believe there's a voodoo curse on them.

title: Good Night Sweet Skipper
description: The Skipper is reliving a dream where his troop was forced to turn their radio into a communicator. He can't remember anything when he awakes and the castaways precisely need to do just this, unfortunately the Skipper can't fall asleep.

title: Wrongway Feldman
description: Wrongway Feldman is located living on the island. After repeatedly being unable to get Wrongway Feldman to take them civilization they attempt to trick him in to doing so with Gilligan.

title: President Gilligan
description: The Skipper and Mr. Howell compete for leadership on the island by being named "President." When the castaways cast their votes, the result is surprising.

title: The Sound of Quacking
description: After an injured duck lands on the island the castaways then debate whether it should be used as food, or a messenger.

title: Goodbye Island
description: Gilligan's attempt to turn sap into maple syrup yields a substance that is stronger than glue. The castaways patch up the Minnow and prepare to go back out to sea.

title: The Big Gold Strike
description: Gilligan's gold strike complicates their attempts to leave the island in an inflatable raft.

title: Waiting for Watubi
description: The Skipper is convinced he is doomed after he accidentally disturbs the resting place of a vengeful Tiki god.

title: Angel on the Island
description: The castaways hold an off Broadway play starring Ginger Grant, however, Mr Howell wants to use his wife as the lead.

title: Birds Gotta Fly, Fish Gotta Talk
description: During Christmas, the Castaways get homesick and remember the first day they were shipwrecked.

title: Three Million Dollars More or Less
description: Mr. Howell gets in over his head after loosing a series of escalating bets against Gilligan.

title: Water, Water Everywhere
description: The castaways desperately try to find a new water source as they have completely exhausted their current water supply.

title: So Sorry, My Island Now
description: A Japanese solder arrives on the island, thinks it's still WWII, and holds the castaways prisoner on their own island.

title: Plant You Now, Dig You Later
description: Gilligan stumbles upon a treasure chest while digging a barbecue pit for Mr. Howell.

title: Little Island, Big Gun
description: Two robbers are hiding out on the island with the authorities close on their trail.

title: X Marks the Spot
description: The military launches a experimental warhead at the island. When the new weapon fails to detonate Gilligan has to climb inside and disarm it.

title: Gilligan Meets Jungle Boy
description: The castaways try to teach a jungle boy found on the island to speak enough English so that he can take a hot-air balloon to Hawaii to rescue them.

title: St. Gilligan and the Dragon
description: A gender rift causes the castaways to camp in two different groups. The women in one and the men in the other. After a few bad dreams, and some bad food, the two camps realize how much the need each other.

title: Big Man on a Little Stick
description: A tsunami causes a surfer to land on the island, and the castaways try to find a way to send him back with their tale.

title: Diamonds Are an Ape's Best Friend
description: The Howells cannot locate a diamond broach, and everyone is a suspect in its disappearance. Gilligan soon discovers an aggressive gorilla in the forest, and soon this great ape disrupts everything by kidnapping Mrs. Howell.

title: How to Be a Hero
description: Gilligan over hears the castaways talking about finding a way to boost his confidence. Gilligan plays along and ends up confronting a real head hunter, whom he is convinced is a phony.

title: The Return of Wrongway Feldman
description: Wrongway returns to the island with his plane, and the islanders are hopeful he told others about them being stranded. Wrongway did not tell others; as a matter of fact, he decides to live on the island forever.

title: The Matchmaker
description: Mrs Howell is tired of island life without social events. When she sees Gilligan and MaryAnn talking to each other, she decides they are a perfect match. Mr Howell does not want to play matchmaker but is forced to help with the scheme.

title: Music Hath Charms
description: The castaways form a band for entertainment and diversion. But Gilligan's drumbeats are mistaken by tribes on other islands as a declaration of war.

title: New Neighbor Sam
description: Gilligan and Skippy hear voices behind the bushes, talking like gangsters who plan to shoot anyone they see. They tell the others and make plans to find the gangsters boat so they can escape the island. It turns out to be a parrot talking.

title: They're Off and Running
description: Skipper and Mr Howell set up a turtle race. If the Skipper loses, Gillian must be Mrs Howells servant. Skipper finds a way to make sure his turtle wins. Mr Howell finds out and makes a counter move. Gillian ends up causing problems.

title: Three to Get Ready
description: Gilligan finds the "eye of the idol" a magic stone that grants the bearer three wishes.

title: Forget Me Not
description: When the Skipper hears the navy will hold maneuvers in the waters nearby, he and Gilligan make plans to catch their attention. Gilligan knocks the Skipper out and he wakes up with amnesia. The Professor hypnotizes him to get his memory back.

title: Diogenes, Won't You Please Go Home?
description: Skipper finds out that Gilligan has been keeping a diary, and then everyone knows about it. Gilligan says it is about him saving the day when a Japanese soldier took them hostage. Everyone tells the story their way, where they are the hero.

title: Physical Fatness
description: Skipper and Gilligan plan on joining the Navy whenever they are rescued from the island. However, Skipper has to lose weight and Gilligan must gain weight.

title: It's Magic
description: The castaways find a magician's chest of magic tricks. They each decide to learn one of the tricks and put on a show. While rehearsing, Gilligan overhears others talking negatively about him, so he decides to run away.

title: Goodbye Old Paint
description: A famous painter lands on the island and says he is going to live there as he is finished with civilization. Since he has a short-wave radio, the castaways try to flatter him into letting them use the radio.

title: My Fair Gilligan
description: Gillian saves Mrs Howell's life, and Mr Howell decides to adopt Gillian since he is as brave as a son.

title: A Nose by Any Other Name
description: Gilligan climbs a tree to collect coconut, and then falls to the ground. He nose takes the worst of the fall as it swells up to twice the size. The Professor decides he should teach first aid to everyone as he treats Gilligan.

title: Gilligan's Mother-in-Law
description: Natives from a nearby island visit the castaways in search of a husband for one of the women. The daughter decides on Gilligan. Her native boyfriend shows up and wants to fight a duel for the woman.

title: Beauty Is as Beauty Does
description: Ginger, MaryAnn, and Mrs Howell decide to hold a beauty contest to see which of them is the prettiest. Gilligan has to cast the deciding vote.

title: The Little Dictator
description: A Latin American dictator is exiled to the island.

title: Smile, You're on Mars Camera
description: A satellite bound for Mars lands on the island. The castaways hope to use it to provide visual evidence to the world that they are still alive.

title: The Sweepstakes
description: Gilligan wins the lottery and is invited to the Howell's country club. After feeling lonely he issues IOUs to the others so they may also attend. He quickly misplaces the wining ticket and they all get evicted.

title: Quick Before It Sinks
description: The professor's bamboo poles in the lagoon indicate that the island is sinking. In an attempt to spare the feelings of the women the men start a futile project in the middle of the night building huts on higher ground.

title: Castaways Pictures Presents
description: Finding a box containing movie material and raw film, the Castaways under the direction of Mr. Howell shoot a movie about their shipwreck, in hopes that somebody finds the film and rescues them.

title: Agonized Labor
description: While listening to the radio, Gilligan and the Skipper hear that Mr Howell is believed to be bankrupted.

title: Nyet, Nyet, Not Yet
description: A Soviet space capsule carrying two Russian Cosmonauts goes off course and lands in the lagoon.

title: Hi Fi Gilligan
description: An accidental blow to the head causes Gilligan's tooth fillings to act as a radio receiver.

title: The Chain of Command
description: The Skipper attempts to train Gilligan to take charge if anything were to happen to him. Promptly something does happen to him, he goes missing.

title: Don't Bug the Mosquitoes
description: The rock band "The Mosquitoes" arrive on the island for some much-needed R&R. But the castaways try to make their lives miserable so they'll want to leave--and take them with them.

title: Gilligan Gets Bugged
description: Gilligan's thinks he is doomed after being bitten by a yellow and green bug. Soon, the other castaways are also bitten by the same bug.

title: Mine Hero
description: Gilligan accidentally pulls ashore a WWII mine, and later tries to drag it out to sea.

title: Erika Tiffany Smith to the Rescue
description: Erika Tiffany Smith shows up and wants to buy the island, but falls in love with the Professor.

title: Not Guilty
description: The castaways discover that they are all wanted for questioning in a murder that took place right before they left Hawaii.

title: You've Been Disconnected
description: A telephone cable washes up on the island after a bad storm. The castaways try to use it to call home for help.

title: The Postman Cometh
description: When the Professor, Skipper, and Gilligan all try to romance Mary Ann to console her after her boyfriend proposes to another girl, Mary Ann misunderstands and thinks she has caught the fatal "roomus igloomus" from eating poison mushrooms.

title: Seer Gilligan
description: Gilligan finds seeds on the island that allows him to read the thoughts of others. After everybody starts to consume these seeds a rift occurs among the castaways.

title: Love Me, Love My Skipper
description: Party time! But the castaways must choose which party -- the Howells' gala or a celebration for the skipper.

title: Gilligan's Living Doll
description: The castaways try to find a way to get a robot who has landed on the island to provide them with their rescue.

title: Forward March
description: Without warning, someone starts throwing hand grenades at the castaways. They start to plan how to avoid the attacks and find out who is doing it, or should they surrender?

title: Ship Ahoax
description: To cheer up the other castaways, Ginger (aided by the Professor) puts on a fortune-telling act. They have the whole group convinced she has supernatural powers, including Ginger herself, when her prediction comes true.

title: Feed the Kitty
description: A circus lion is found running amok on the island.

title: Operation: Steam Heat
description: Gilligan discovers a hot water spring on the island, and the castaways are thrilled by the prospect of having hot running water. The downside, as the Professor knows, is that this discovery proves the existence of an active volcano on the island.

title: Will the Real Mr. Howell Please Stand Up?
description: A man, who has assumed Mr Howell's identity, washes ashore on the island after falling overboard from a yacht in the south pacific.

title: Ghost-a-Go-Go
description: A man dressed as a ghost tries to scare the castaways off the island.

title: Allergy Time
description: Everybody finds themselves allergic to Gilligan.

title: The Friendly Physician
description: A mad scientist invites the castaways to his island, where he hopes to conduct strange experiments on them.

title: V for Vitamins
description: The Professor tells his fellow castaways that if they don't find a way to grow more oranges and other fruits on the island, they risk dying from vitamin deficiencies.

title: Mr. and Mrs. ???
description: A radio bulletin states that the minister who married the Howell's was a fraud.

title: Meet the Meteor
description: A meteorite hits the island, and its cosmic rays accelerate the life process in living things, causing Gilligan to dream about the castaways celebrating fifty years on the island.

title: Up at Bat
description: Gilligan is bitten in the neck by a bat and fears he will transform into a vampire as a result. Gilligan's troubled sleep is haunted by a dream that he is indeed a vampire living in a European castle in 1895 where unsuspecting travelers and a famous detective and his doctor assistant appear at his doorstep. Will they be invited to stay for -or as- dinner?

title: Gilligan vs. Gilligan
description: A KGB agent that is identical to Gilligan questions the castaways about the nature of their shipwreck.

title: Pass the Vegetables, Please
description: While fishing in the lagoon Gilligan catches a crate filled with vegetable seeds. These seeds grow plants at a miraculous rate, but like everything good that happens on the island, there's a catch.

title: The Producer
description: A down on his luck producer, Harold Hecuba, appears on the island and refuses to make contact with his offshore boat until he has something to show on Broadway. After the castaways perform a musical version of Hamlet he slips away.

title: Voodoo
description: Gillian loses his rabbits foot in a cave, and finds buried clay items from earlier villagers. The cave also holds a witch doctor who decides to place curses on the castaways and put them in a voodoo spell.

title: Where There's a Will
description: Mr. Howell names the other castaways as beneficiaries in his will, then fears they may be trying to kill him for his money.

title: Man with a Net
description: An eccentric butterfly collector, Lord Beasley Waterford, is found meandering on the island in search of a rare butterfly.

title: Hair Today, Gone Tomorrow
description: After Gilligan's hair falls out he retreats to a cave on the other side of the island.

title: Ring Around Gilligan
description: A mad scientist hiding out on the island plants a ring that Gilligan finds. Soon after, he uses this ring to make the bearer follow his whims.

title: Topsy-Turvy
description: After Gilligan hits his head he sees everything upside down.

title: The Invasion
description: While fishing, the Skipper and Gilligan pull a locked U.S. Government attache case out of the lagoon.

title: The Kidnapper
description: The women are each taken in turn and held for ransom.

title: And Then There Were None
description: After the castaways disappear one by one, Gilligan dreams he's Dr. Gilligan and Mr. Hyde.

title: All About Eva
description: Plain and homely Eva Grubb escapes the scorn and rejection of civilization in a motor boat and lands on Gilligan's island, where Ginger and Mary Ann are confident a Hollywood makeover can bring out Eva's hidden beauty and restore her self-confidence.

title: Gilligan Goes Gung-Ho
description: Newly appointed Deputy Sheriff Gilligan gets everyone fumed up when he takes his new position way too seriously.

title: Take a Dare
description: A dishonest game show contestant arrives on the island.

title: Court-Martial
description: The Maritime Board accuses the Skipper of being solely responsible for the loss of the SS Minnow, so the castaways recreate the shipwreck to discover the truth.

title: The Hunter
description: Gilligan is the new target of an eccentric big-game hunter. If he can survive 24 hours without being killed, he is the winner.

title: Lovey's Secret Admirer
description: Mrs. Howell is receiving love letters from somebody on the island.

title: Our Vines Have Tender Apes
description: An actor prepares for a role by making the castaways think he is really Tongo, an ape-man.

title: Gilligan's Personal Magnetism
description: After being struck by lightning, Gilligan becomes magnetic, and when struck a second time, becomes temporarily invisible.

title: Splashdown
description: The castaways have three chances to attract the attention of a space agency.

title: High Man on the Totem Pole
description: The castaways find a headhunter tribe's totem pole on the island. The head on the top of it bears an uncanny resemblance to Gilligan--which comes in handy when the headhunters return to the island.

title: The Second Ginger Grant
description: After Mary Ann watches Ginger perform on the island she hits her head giving her amnesia thus believing that she is Ginger Grant.

title: The Secret of Gilligan's Island
description: Gilligan ends up dreaming that the islanders are all cave dwellers when he finds prehistoric stone tablets.

title: Slave Girl
description: After Gilligan rescues a native from drowning in the lagoon she becomes indebted to him.

title: It's a Bird, It's a Plane
description: U.S. Air Force Jetpack X-JP was lost at sea and found by Gilligan.

title: The Pigeon
description: The castaways attach a message to a homing pigeon that has flown off course and landed on the island.

title: Bang! Bang! Bang!
description: A lost crate containing a top-secret clay that can be converted to explosives washes up on the island. Not knowing what it is, they make several items with it--including Gilligan's new tooth fillings.

title: Gilligan, the Goddess
description: Natives arrive on the island looking for a white goddess to sacrifice to their volcano god.
